intro: Rosa oligantha var. fujisanensis, commonly known as the Japanese rock rose, is a compact shrub native to Japan. It features dense, thorny stems and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils, often found in mountainous regions. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its floral display. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in cooler climates.
